title: Game missing colors?
body: Screenshot in the link, I went into an ARAM game and already in the loading screen there was no background or borders around splashes and icons and the text was black. Then in the game it looked like this, all the health/mana bars were just grey as well as player names.

replies.body: This exact same issue occurred during several pregame lobbies where the chat was the same "shade" of black (whereas dark enough not to communicate). Is this a recurring problem within the client -I have already reset the client after each game- or is this a setting that could be reverted?
Are you using any overlays or third party apps that run with league?  Overlays can play a huge culprit in these color oddities.  Let me know, though!

Been seeing a few reports on this, and it may be a bug.  While I've heard that alt-tabbing has worked out for some players, the issue itself may be caused by a corrupt config.  Let me know if resetting your config fixes this up for you:

Log into the game client.
Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
Delete the file  named **game.cfg** and **persistedsettings.json**
Go into a custom game and verify that settings have saved properly.  Leave game to sync settings. 

Since we're still investigating this, your troubleshooting could help a lot of players!

I think alt-tabbing works only if you are alt-tabbed while the game loads , as a consequence you will have your own health bar grayed out (or black).
Also it doesn't always happen , perhaps if he will reinstall the game , it will go well , Porocles-sama?
Might also be his own computer , since 25 fps and 100ms+ doesn't look like a healthy gameplay. (yes i know , ping doesn't really affect the gameplay except for the delay)

The update could have also corrupted some game assets for those impacted, so a repair could certainly be a potential solution.  Run a repair through the client or the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), and let me know how it goes.
Thank you , works fine for me!
Yes!  Thanks for the update on that.
